alert.note: Alert for Morton (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 21 at 2:22PM CST until February 23 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, snow and blowing snow. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills as low as 40 below zero expected. * WHERE...Morton County. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 6 PM CST this evening. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to Noon CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the Monday evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while outside. Wear appropriate clothing, covering exposed skin. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
